{{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=GAN |action1date=23:07, 23 February 2012 |action1link=Talk:Operation Alsos/GA1 |action1result=listed |action1oldid=478508298 |action2=WAR |action2date=23:46, 8 April 2012 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Alsos Mission |action2result=approved |action2oldid=485857567 |action3=FAC |action3date=07:57, 29 August 2014 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Alsos Mission/archive1 |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=623027653 |dykdate=27 February 2012 |dykentry=... that during World War II, the multi-national '''[[Operation Alsos|Alsos Mission]]''' captured and dismantled a German experimental [[nuclear reactor]] ''(pictured)''? |currentstatus=FA |topic=war |four=no |maindate=30 March 2015 }} {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|A-Class=pass|British=y|US=y|Weaponry=y|Intel=y|WWII=y}} == Sentence == ''The interrogation of German prisoners indicated that uranium and thorium were being processed in It was discovered that most of the output was sent to the Auergesellschaft''
This first sentence seems to be broken. Someone shoudl fix it. [[User:StoneProphet|StoneProphet]] ([[User talk:StoneProphet|talk]]) 21:35, 29 February 2012 (UTC) *Fixed. Thatnks for that. [[User:Hawkeye7|Hawkeye7]] ([[User talk:Hawkeye7|talk]]) 22:40, 29 February 2012 (UTC) Groves memoir 'Now it can be Told' is not a reliable source and is heavily biased against the European scientists and in particular the French, so the comment that Joliot was not fully behind the Allied mission is an aspersion cast by Groves and not in any way factual and should be removed. â€” Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/110.174.83.95|110.174.83.95]] ([[User talk:110.174.83.95|talk]]) 01:15, 27 July 2012 (UTC) == Fall of Rome == Illusory: Based on illusion; not real. The fall of Rome was real just delayed until 4 June 1944; it was therefore elusive. No edit waring please![[Special:Contributions/128.170.224.12|128.170.224.12]] ([[User talk:128.170.224.12|talk]]) 22:41, 16 July 2013 (UTC) == Congratulations! == Congratulations to all the contributors to this featured article. You deserve a lot of applause, recognition and appreciation. What a wonderful article. :  [[User:Bfpage|Bfpage]] |[[User talk:Bfpage|leave a message]]  01:15, 31 March 2015 (UTC)
